verses.text: These \add are\add* also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.
\add It is\add* the glory of God to conceal a thing: But the honour of kings \add is\add* to search out a matter.
The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, And the heart of kings \add is\add* unsearchable.
Take away the dross from the silver, And there shall come forth a vessel for the finer.
Take away the wicked \add from\add* before the king, And his throne shall be established in righteousness.
Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king, And stand not in the place of great \add men:\add*
For better \add it is\add* that it be said unto thee, Come up hither; Than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince Whom thine eyes have seen.
Go not forth hastily to strive, Lest \add thou know not\add* what to do in the end thereof, When thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.
Debate thy cause with thy neighbour \add himself;\add* And discover not a secret \add to\add* another:
Lest he that heareth \add it\add* put thee to shame, And thine infamy turn not away.
A word fitly spoken \add Is like\add* apples of gold in pictures of silver.
\add As\add* an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, \add So is\add* a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.
As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, \add So is\add* a faithful messenger to them that send him: For he refresheth the soul of his masters.
Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift \add Is like\add* clouds and wind without rain.
By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, And a soft tongue breaketh the bone.
Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, Lest thou be filled there\add with\add*, and vomit it.
Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbourâ€™s house; Lest he be weary \add of\add* thee, and \add so\add* hate thee.
A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour \add Is\add* a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.
Confidence in an unfaithful \add man\add* in time of trouble \add Is like\add* a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.
\add As\add* he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, \add And as\add* vinegar upon nitre, So \add is\add* he that singeth songs to a heavy heart.
If thine enemy \add be\add* hungry, give him bread to eat; And if he \add be\add* thirsty, give him water to drink:
For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, And the \sc Lord\sc* shall reward thee.
The north wind driveth away rain: So \add doth\add* an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.
\add It is\add* better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, Than with a brawling woman and in a wide house.
\add As\add* cold waters to a thirsty soul, So \add is\add* good news from a far country.
A righteous \add man\add* falling down before the wicked \add Is as\add* a troubled fountain, and a corrupt spring.
\add It is\add* not good to eat much honey: So \add for men\add* to search their own glory \add is not\add* glory.
He that \add hath\add* no rule over his own spirit \add Is like\add* a city \add that is\add* broken down, \add and\add* without walls.
